task.title: Making black-and-white prints
task.shortdesc: Transfer on to paper the photos that you've captured on your film roll so that you can see the photos and show them around.

taskbody.prereq:
Before you take prints of the photos on the film roll, turn the film roll into a photographic negative.
Prepare a tray each for the developer, the stop bath, and the fixer.
Put the film roll into the developer tray and wait for the designated time while agitating the liquid in the tray every 30 seconds.
When the designated time is over, put the roll into the stop bath tray for the designated time while constantly agitating the liquid in the tray.
When the designated time is over, put the roll in the fixer tray and wait for the designated time while agitating the liquid in the tray every 30 seconds
When the designated time is over, take out the roll (which has now turned into a film negative) and wash it thoroughly in water.

step.cmd: Expose the photographic negative on to the enlarger.

substep.cmd: Put the negative in the enlarger tray such that the shiny side is facing upwards and the tiny numbers are facing away from you.
Turn the aperture knob of the enlarger till the image is projected on to the baseboard. Then, adjust the brightness and sharpness.

step.cmd: Fix the image on to the black and white photo paper.
Wash the printed paper thoroughly with plain water so that no trace of the chemicals remain.
